bibl.title: Hisayo Kuwahara v. Henry M. White. Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: In the Matter of the Application of Sakutaro Kuwahara for Writ of Habeas Corpus.
Filed in the United States District Court
This is in the matter of HISAYO KUWAHARA.

Comes Henry M. White as United States Commissioner of Immigration at the Port of Seattle, and makes return to the Writ of Habeas Corpus herein issued on the 5th day of February, 1920, and at the time and the place required in said writ brings before the Court the body of the said HISAYO KUWAHARA, and for further return states and alleges all the matters and things set forth in this return to the order to show cause already on file herein.
The President of the United States of America,
To Henry M. White, United States Commissioner of Immigration, at the Port of Seattle,

We Command You, that you have the body of Hisayo Kuwahara by you imprisoned and detained, as it is said, together with the time and cause of such imprisonment and detention, by whatsoever name said Hisayo Kuwahara shall be called or charged, before the Hon. C.H.Hanford, Jeremiah Neterer, United States District Judge for the Western District of Washington, at the Court Room of the United States District Court, in the City of Seattle, Wash., in the Northern Division of said Western District of Washington, on the 7th day of February, 1920, A.D. 189, at at 10.00 o'clock in the forenoon, to do and receive what shall and then and there be considered concerning the said Hisayo Kuwahara.
And have you then and there this writ.

WITNESS the Hon C. H. Hanford Jeremiah Neterer, Judge of the United States District Court for the Western District of Washington, this 5th day of February in the year of our Lord one thousand eight nine hundred and twenty.
The within is a full, true and correct copy of an original writ this day issued. WITNESS my hand and official seal this 5d day of Feb. 1920
